title: Pure Sine Sub Bass
trackReference: James Blake - Limit to Your Love
description: Use Operator's single sine wave to create a clean sub-bass, focusing only on the volume envelope for a tight punch.

title: Basic Square Lead
description: Synthesize a raw square wave lead in Analog. Use EQ Eight to slightly roll off high-end harshness.

title: Simple Plucked Pad
description: Use two sine waves in Operator (one slightly detuned) with a fast decay envelope and add a large Reverb tail.

title: White Noise Hi-Hat
description: Generate a closed hi-hat sound using white noise and a fast decay envelope. Use Gate for cleanliness.

title: Basic Filter Sweep FX
description: Apply Auto Filter to a sustained chord and automate the cutoff frequency from low to high over 4 bars.

title: Kick Drum Pitch Envelope
description: Synthesize a kick drum by setting a very fast pitch envelope that quickly drops from high frequency to a low rumble.

title: Mono Arp Sequence
description: Create a simple sawtooth patch in Analog and use the Arpeggiator to sequence a simple, rhythmic mono pattern.

title: Delay Time Rhythms
description: Create a short percussive loop and use Simple Delay (with high feedback and dry/wet) to create complex polyrhythms.

title: Lo-Cut/Hi-Cut EQ
trackReference: Tame Impala - Feels Like We Only Go Backwards
description: Take a full loop (drums/synth) and use EQ Eight to create two extreme versions: one with heavy low-cut, one with heavy high-cut.

title: Phase Cancellation Effect
description: Duplicate a track, invert the phase on the duplicate using Utility, then slightly offset the timing with Simple Delay to create unique filtering.

title: Chorus Width Effect
trackReference: Tears for Fears - Everybody Wants to Rule the World
description: Apply Chorus-Ensemble to a mono synth line to drastically increase its stereo width and shimmer.

title: Ping Pong Delay
trackReference: U2 - Where the Streets Have No Name
description: Set up Ping Pong Delay on a plucked melody to have the repetitions bounce cleanly between the left and right speakers.

title: Warm Analog Pad
description: Use two detuned sawtooth waves in Analog with a slow attack and release to create a lush, warm pad texture.

title: Ring Modulator Bell
description: Use two high-frequency carriers in Operator and engage the Ring Mod function to create a metallic, inharmonic bell sound.

title: Basic Compressions
description: Use Compressor on a dry drum loop to achieve a basic 3:1 ratio with medium attack, increasing overall punch.

title: Pitch Bend FX
description: Take a short synth stab and automate the Transpose parameter to create a rapid, deep pitch bend.

title: Grainy Reverb Ambience
trackReference: Fever Ray - If I Had A Heart
description: Use a massive, diffused Reverb with a long decay time and very low cut-off frequency to create dark, grainy ambience.

title: Overdrive Distortion
description: Apply Overdrive to a synth bass to make it clip and distort, but roll off the extreme high frequencies with EQ.

title: Phaser Swirl
trackReference: Pink Floyd - Shine On You Crazy Diamond
description: Use Phaser with a high feedback setting on a sustained synth chord to create a deep, swirling effect.

title: Gate Snare
trackReference: Eurythmics - Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)
description: Apply Gate to a sustained noise or clap sample, using the hold and release parameters to shorten it aggressively.

title: Resonant Filter Whistle
description: Use Auto Filter with high resonance on a noise source and sweep the cutoff rapidly to create a 'whistle' or 'scream' effect.

title: Simple Sidechain Pump
description: Set up a sidechain compressor on a pad sound keyed by the kick drum to achieve a basic, rhythmic 'pumping' effect.

title: Drum Bus Tone Shaper
description: Apply Drum Bus to a full drum loop and use the 'Boom' and 'Crunch' parameters to enhance the low-end and high-end saturation.

title: Vinyl Crackle FX
description: Use Vinyl Distortion to generate crackle and change the 'Poles' and 'Rec.' settings to simulate an old, damaged record.

title: Basic Wavetable Lead
description: Load a basic saw wave into Wavetable and only use the 'Position' control to manually sweep through the wave, creating timbral movement.

title: LFO Controlled Filter Wobble
description: Assign an LFO to modulate the cutoff frequency of the Auto Filter on a synth bass to create a rhythmic wobble.

title: Dynamic Stereo Delay
description: Use the Echo device and link the delay times for a rhythmic repeat, then use the 'Ducking' feature to push the original signal out.

title: FM Pad with Detune
description: Create a multi-operator FM pad (A modulating B) and apply heavy detuning to the carriers for a rich, unstable sound.

title: Wavetable Unison Stacks
description: Use Wavetable's unison modes (e.g., Shimmer or Noise) to create an extremely wide and thick supersaw-style lead.

title: Gated Reverb Snare
trackReference: Phil Collins - In the Air Tonight
description: Create a huge Reverb tail on a snare and use the Gate device triggered by the snare hit to cut the tail abruptly.

title: Flanger Risers/Fallers
description: Use a heavy, wet Flanger on a noise sweep (created with Analog) to enhance the sense of movement and tension.

title: Frequency Shifter Aliens
description: Apply Frequency Shifter to a vocal or percussion sample to create unnatural, metallic or 'alien' speech effects.

title: Haas Effect Widening
description: Duplicate a mono sound. Pan one left, one right. Offset one track by 10-30ms using Simple Delay for stereo widening (Haas Effect).

title: Vocoder Robot Voice
description: Use Vocoder with a clean synth carrier (saw wave) and an acapella or spoken word sample as the modulator to create a robot voice.

title: Subtle Vinyl Warping
description: Use Vinyl Distortion but focus on the 'Warp' parameter to create slow, subtle pitch fluctuations typical of old vinyl.

title: Complex Reverb Pre-Delay
description: Set a long Pre-Delay time on the Reverb so the tail starts significantly after the dry signal, creating clarity in a large space.

title: Cabinet Speaker Simulation
description: Apply Cabinet to a synth or bassline to emulate the tone and room reflections of a miked guitar/bass amp.

title: LFO Controlled Pan
description: Use Auto Pan with a sine wave LFO set to a rhythmic rate (e.g., 1/4) to make a sound rhythmically move across the stereo field.

title: Wavetable Sub-Oscillator Design
description: Use Wavetable to design a bass patch where one oscillator is a clean sub (sine) and a second oscillator provides harmonic content.

title: Creative Multiband EQ
description: Use EQ Eight to heavily filter one frequency band (e.g., 500 Hz) to create a notch, then automate that notch for a sweeping 'wah' effect.

title: Delay Feedback Texture
description: Increase Simple Delay feedback past 100% (carefully!) and use Auto Filter inside the feedback loop to shape the infinite echo.

title: Ping Pong with Uneven Times
description: Set the left and right delay times to related but uneven values (e.g., 1/4 and 1/6) to create a confusing, off-kilter rhythm.

title: Amp Simulation Crunch
trackReference: The White Stripes - Seven Nation Army
description: Apply the 'Blues' setting on the Amp device to a bassline to introduce low-end warmth and harmonic saturation.

title: FM Percussion Sound
description: Use Operator's C>B>A algorithm with short envelopes to synthesize a complex, metallic, micro-percussive sound.

title: Random Arp Swing
description: Use the Arpeggiator and map the 'Random' effect device to slightly modulate the Rate or Gate of the Arpeggiator for subtle timing variations.

title: Simple Glue Compression
description: Apply Glue Compressor to a drum loop with a fast attack and release and moderate ratio (4:1) to 'glue' the pieces together.

title: Corpus Resonator FX
description: Load Corpus onto a simple noise burst and experiment with the 'Marimba' or 'Membrane' models to create synthetic impacts.

title: LFO Controlled Unison Detune
description: Use Wavetable, enable Unison, and assign an LFO to slightly modulate the 'Detune' parameter for subtle, organic pitch variation.

title: Vinyl Noise Floor
description: Use Vinyl Distortion to generate crackle and change the 'Poles' and 'Rec.' settings to simulate an old, damaged record.

title: Reverb Freeze Texture
description: Use a Reverb with a high Decay time and use the 'Freeze' button (or high feedback automation) to sustain an endless chord/texture.

title: Multiband Dynamics Bass
description: Apply Multiband Dynamics to a bassline. Heavily compress the high band to tame fret noise, and lightly compress the low band for consistency.

title: Granular Pad Texture
description: Load a short vocal sample into Granulator II and manipulate the 'Grain Size' and 'Spray' to create a shifting, ethereal pad.

title: Bit Crusher Drum Damage
description: Use Redux on a drum loop and reduce the 'Downsample' rate heavily to create an intentionally damaged, digital sound.

title: Complex Wavetable Modulations
description: Use Wavetable, assign two different LFOs to modulate the 'Position' and 'Filter Cutoff' simultaneously for extreme timbral movement.

title: Return Track FX Chain
description: Set up a track to send only the high-frequency content to a return track containing heavy Delay and Reverb.

title: Frequency Shifter Sweeps
description: Use Frequency Shifter on a dry synth and modulate the 'Frequency' knob with a slow LFO for a continuously shifting metallic sweep.

title: Saturator Mid-Range Focus
description: Apply Saturator to a kick drum, focusing the drive only on the mid-range (around 100-250 Hz) for punch and loudness.

title: Random Sampler Drum Hits
description: Load 4 different one-shot samples into Sampler and use a randomized LFO or routing to trigger the samples in an unpredictable order.

title: Extreme Resonant Feedback
description: Use Filter Delay, set one delay line to max feedback, and sweep its high-resonance filter to generate a loud, chaotic screech.

title: FM Bassline with Filter Follow
description: Create an FM bass. Use the 'Envelope Follower' on Auto Filter to open the filter based on the incoming bass volume.

title: Drum Synth Tom Drum
description: Use the 'Tom' setting in Drum Synth and adjust the pitch and decay envelopes to synthesize a classic 80s electronic tom sound.

title: Stereo Mid-Side EQ
description: Use EQ Eight in M/S mode to boost high frequencies only on the 'Side' channel to widen the hats/reverb without touching the kick/bass.

title: Wavetable Growl Bass
description: Use Wavetable's sub-bass oscillator and modulate the filter cutoff aggressively with a complex LFO, then drive it with Saturator.

title: Tension Riser (Reverse FX)
description: Take a loud crash cymbal, bounce it, reverse it, then apply huge Reverb. This creates a reverse reverb riser effect.

title: Complex Chorus Flanger Combo
description: Stack Chorus and Flanger on a lead sound and use slow, independent modulation rates to create a thick, detuned, moving sound.

title: Subtle Vinyl Hiss Layer
description: Create only the hiss from Vinyl Distortion and route it to a separate track. Use Utility to blend it in very quietly beneath a track for atmosphere.

title: Multiband Glue Compression
description: Use Multiband Dynamics in 'Expander' mode on the top two frequency bands of a drum loop to accentuate transients and add snap.

title: Grainy Stutter Edit
description: Apply Beat Repeat to a synth phrase and use the 'Grid' and 'Variation' settings to generate complex, rhythmic stutter edits.

title: Corpus String Pluck
description: Synthesize a simple pluck with Analog and then route it into Corpus, using the 'String' model to give it physical resonance.

title: Randomized Delay Filter
description: Create a delay loop and map the 'Random' effect to slightly change the high-pass filter cutoff on the delayed signal only.

title: FM Bell to Noise Sweep
description: Design a bright FM bell. Automate the volume of the bell down while simultaneously automating a high-pass filtered noise source up (noise tail).

title: Creative Phase Rotation
description: Use Utility to flip the phase (0°/180°) on a bassline at specific points to create intentional cancellation/reinforcement.

title: Return Track Filtering
description: Set up a return track with a filter (100% wet). Send dry signal to it and automate the filter cutoff on the return to create selective delay/reverb filtering.

title: Complex MIDI Envelope Shaping
description: Use the MIDI Envelope Follower on a drum loop to generate MIDI data that then controls the volume of a completely separate synth track.

title: Deep Space Ambience
description: Layer multiple Reverb and Delay effects on a white noise source. Use Saturator to drive the noise and create dark, resonant drone texture.

title: Full Drum Kit Synthesis
description: Synthesize a full, distinct electronic drum kit (Kick, Snare, Hi-Hat, Tom) using only Drum Synth devices on separate MIDI tracks.

title: Wavetable Resampling Layering
description: Create a complex Wavetable sound, resample it, and load the sample into Sampler. Use Sampler's envelopes and filters for further processing.

title: Advanced Sidechain Shaping
description: Sidechain a pad using Glue Compressor. Then, use EQ Eight on the pad after the compressor to boost the frequencies that are being dipped by the pump.

title: Multi-Band Saturation Rack
description: Build an Audio Effect Rack with 3 chains: Low, Mid, and High. Place a different instance of Saturator on each chain for multi-band distortion.

title: Feedback Flanger Riser/Drop
description: Set Flanger feedback to maximum (or use Utility gain before Flanger). Automate the 'Delay Time' drastically to create a loud pitch shift effect.

title: Mastering Chain: Basic Limiting
description: Place Limiter on the Master Bus. Set the 'Ceiling' to -0.3 dB and increase the 'Gain' until the volume reaches commercial loudness without heavy pumping.

title: Frequency-Dependent Delay
description: Use Filter Delay to only process high-frequency content (e.g., 5kHz+) of a full chord, leaving the bass and mid-range dry.

title: Operator Cross-Modulation FX
description: Use Operator's complex algorithms to cross-modulate carriers and modulators (e.g., A modulating B and B modulating A) for chaotic soundscapes.

title: Wavetable Follower Modulation
description: Use Envelope Follower on a drum loop to extract the volume envelope, then use that envelope to modulate Wavetable's wavetable position.

title: Transient Shaping with Drum Bus
description: Apply Drum Bus to a dull percussion hit. Focus on the 'Transient' parameter to increase the initial snap without increasing the sustain.

title: Creative Bit/Sample Reduction
description: Use Redux and automate both the 'Bit Reduction' and 'Downsample' parameters simultaneously on a sustained synth pad.

title: Multi-Tempo Delay FX
description: Set Echo to a rhythmic time (e.g., dotted 1/8th) and use a subtle LFO to gently modulate the rate for a 'wobbly' tempo feel.

title: Dynamic Stereo Bus Comp
description: Apply Glue Compressor to a group of instruments (e.g., all synths) with a gentle ratio (2:1) and slow attack/fast release for subtle cohesion.

title: Advanced Phaser/Flanger Stereo Trick
description: Set the 'Spin' or 'Stereo' parameter on Phaser/Flanger very high to create extremely wide, asymmetrical movement between the channels.

title: MIDI Control Rack
description: Build a rack containing an EQ, a Saturator, and a Delay. Map one Macro to simultaneously control the EQ Hi-Cut and the Saturator Drive.

title: Complex Reverb/Delay Feedback Loop
description: Route a Delay's output back into a Reverb's input, and then route the Reverb's output back to the Delay's input (on a return track).

title: Mute/Solo Drum Rack Mapping
description: Create a Drum Rack with multiple drum kits on separate chains. Map one Macro knob to select (Mute/Solo) between the different kits.

title: FM Kick/Snare Layering
description: Design a deep kick drum in one Operator instance and a transient-rich snare/clap sound in a second instance. Layer them perfectly.

title: Extreme Mid-Side Dynamics
description: Use Multiband Dynamics in M/S mode to heavily compress the Mid channel below 150 Hz, and heavily expand the Side channel above 5 kHz.

title: Chorus-Ensemble Detune FX
description: Use the Chorus-Ensemble in its 'Vibrato' or 'Chorus' modes with extreme modulation depth and high frequency for a wild, detuned lead.

title: Analog Wavetable Combination
description: Layer a warm square wave from Analog with a gritty, filtered Wavetable sound. Use Utility to balance their levels and phase.

title: Mastering Chain: Stereo Widening
description: Use Utility to widen the overall stereo image, but use Multiband Dynamics in M/S mode to ensure low frequencies remain mono.

title: Drum Synth Layered Snare
description: Use two instances of Drum Synth—one set to 'Clap' and one set to 'Snare'—and process them individually before routing them to a single bus.

title: Chaos Modulation Rack
description: Create a rack where a Random effect is mapped to control an LFO rate, and the LFO is mapped to control the filter cutoff. Introduce controlled chaos.

title: Personal Synthesis Masterpiece
description: Design an entirely new, complex sound (bass, lead, or FX) using concepts learned throughout the 99 previous days. This is your signature sound.
